alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Washington, northeastern McIntosh, central Adair, southern Cherokee and central Muskogee Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 129 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Baron to 5 miles southeast of Hulbert to 4 miles northwest of Oktaha to 5 miles south of Council Hill. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Stilwell... Fort Gibson... Checotah... West Fork... Lincoln... Warner... Westville... Oktaha... Braggs... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Adair State Park... Christie... Greenleaf State Park... Pumpkin Center... Maryetta... Cookson... Cherokee Landing State Park... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 252 and 277. Interstate 49 between mile markers 50 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
